results.title: Glimpses of Western India
results.creator_credit: S.N.S Sastry, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Bombay and the sights to see nearby; Malabar Hill and the hanging gardens; the eight century Hindu cave temples of Elephanta island; Nasik and its pilgrims; Aurangabad the Mogul City; tombs of mediaeval kings; the Ellora caves; cave frescoes at Aguiba; the landscape and the life of the people.

results.title: Glimpses of Gandhiji = Glimpses of Ghandhi
results.brief_description: A survey of the life or Mahatma Ghandhiji. Recalls his childhood; student life in England; the launching of the Satyagraha Campaign in South Africa and subsequently in India; and his martyrdom in January 1948 when a whole nation was plunged into mourning.

results.title: Glimpses of enchanting Japan
results.brief_description: A colourful variety of aspects of the land and nature of Japan. Beginning with the new year the film introduces the Grand Shrines of Ise, most honoured of the national shrines; the charming doll festival; the dramatic “water drawing’ rites of Nara are illuminated by torch light; the Mibu pantomime of Kyoto and the Dontaku festival of Hakata. Interspersed are shots of ancient temples and shrines contrasting with ultra-modern structures based on traditional architecture.

results.title: A Glimpse at a thousand points
results.brief_description: A discussion of the discoveries of the light deflector. Cathodes ray tube and photocell lead to a simple explanation of how television works and modern developments in television technology.

results.title: Gliding
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and British Information Services
results.brief_description: The increasingly popular sport of gliding as practiced in Britain today. Air and ground shots demonstrate the skills and techniques for taking-off gaining height, flying and landing. An over-all picture of gliding as a family recreation emerges. Former world champion Philip Wills and Ann Burns, holder of four women’s world records, are seen in action.

results.title: Glenn Chandler: Designer woodworker
results.creator_credit: Terry McMahon and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Craft as a Livelihood”.
Glenn Chandler designs and creates articles such as terrariums and fish tanks out of wood and glass. He uses machines to cut wood into shapes as well as working by hand. The articles are sold directly the factory.

results.title: Glazing
results.creator_credit: Richard Philps and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: The film deals entirely with glazing, demonstrating the techniques of glazing mugs, jugs, dishes and bowls, and the decorative effects that can be obtained. The use of transparent glaze is explained and in addition, extra glazing effects such as matt stoneware glaze and oxides on rough and smooth surfaces are demonstrated.
